questions.text: Which of these is the place where Noah's ark landed?
questions.explanation:
Ararat.

	You can read about the ark landing in Genesis 8:4. Ararat means high or holy ground. Noah was in an ark during the great flood that covered the earth because it rained for forty days and nights.

questions.text: Which A word did Jesus call his Father?
questions.explanation:
Abba.

	Abba means father, but it's more like "daddy". You can see the word Abba used three times in the King James Version of the Holy Bible: Mark 14:36, Romans 8:15 and Galatians 4:6.

questions.text: Who from the list was thrown into a fiery furnace but didn't burn, according to Daniel 3 of the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Abednego.

	Abednego was the Babylonian name given to him by King Nebuchadnezzar. His Hebrew name was Azariah which means "strength of the Lord". (I Daniel 1:7)

questions.text: This woman was David's third wife. Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Abigail.

	You can read about David and Abigail in I Samuel chapter 25. Abigail means "the Father's joy". She was originally married to Nabal. Nabal was a very evil man. The Bible says "his heart was dead inside him and he became stone." (I Samuel 25:37)

questions.text: After Omri died, who became king?
questions.explanation:
Ahab.

	You can read about Ahab in I Kings chapters 16-18. Ahab was an evil king. Ahab means "uncle".

questions.text: Who is the only minor prophet who fits into this quiz?
questions.explanation:
Amos.

	Amos is the 30th book of the King James Bible. In the book of Amos the words "I will not again pass by them any more" appear twice in two different verses. Amos means loading, or weighty.

questions.text: Who was Peter's brother who also became a disciple?
questions.explanation:
Andrew.

	You can read about Andrew becoming a disciple in Matthew 10:2. Andrew means a strong man or manly.

questions.text: Who did the Bible say would come and be a deceiver of the Gospel?
questions.explanation:
Antichrist.

	The Antichrist is found at the end of the Bible in the books of I and II John. His job is to make people think that he is the Messiah not Jesus Christ.

questions.text: Which one of Joseph's brothers fits this quiz title?
questions.explanation:
Asher.

	Asher was the son of Zilpah, Leah's handmaiden. His tribe had 1540 people in it (Numbers 1:41). Asher means happiness.

questions.text: What city was Israel told not to publish the book of Jasher in?
questions.explanation:
Askelon.

	You can read about Askelon in the book of II Samuel. In verse 20 of the KJV, they are told not to publish the book of Jasher in Askkelon because then the daughters of the Philistines would rejoice as would the daughters of the males who were uncircumcised.  Askelon means fire of infamy.
